## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm really interested in creating my own token or blockchain. What capabilities does Verus offer to users who want to create their own tokens or blockchains?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus is an excellent choice for that! Verus enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant, and merge-mineable with other blockchains in the Verus network. You'll have a lot of flexibility and control over your own blockchain.

**User:**
That sounds really powerful. What is the advantage of creating a blockchain using Verus' PBaaS (Platform as a Blockchain Service) technology?

**AI Assistant:**
The advantage of creating a blockchain using Verus' PBaaS technology is that it allows projects to start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. This means you can hit the ground running with a robust blockchain infrastructure, without having to build everything from scratch.

**User:**
I've seen some mentions of Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies. What is the purpose of these, and how do they work?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies allow ID owners to define currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. This allows for more efficient and secure DeFi transactions.

**User:**
That's really interesting. What is the benefit of launching a blockchain using Verus, in terms of liquidity pools?

**AI Assistant:**
When launching a blockchain using Verus, a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool can be launched simultaneously, allowing for seamless interactions between the new blockchain and other blockchains in the Verus network. This bridge converter currency has the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies. This means you can easily connect your blockchain to the wider Verus ecosystem, and enable smooth transactions between different blockchains.
What capabilities does Verus offer to users who want to create their own tokens or blockchains?

Verus enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant, and merge-mineable with other blockchains in the Verus network.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
